contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox French commune |name = Quincy |region = Centre |department = Cher |arrondissement = Vierzon |canton = Lury-sur-Arnon |INSEE = 18190 |postal code = 18120 |mayor = Claude Derbez |term = 2008–2014 |intercommunality = [[Communauté de communes des Vals de Cher et d'Arnon|Vals de Cher et d'Arnon]] |longitude = 2.1578 |latitude = 47.1342 |elevation m = 130 |elevation min m = 103 |elevation max m = 136 |area km2 = 18.19 |population = 833 |population date = 2008 }} '''Quincy''' is a [[Communes of France|commune]] in the [[Cher (department)|Cher]] [[Departments of France|department]] in the [[Centre (French region)|Centre]] [[Regions of France|region]] of [[France]]. ==Geography== Quincy is a village located at 10 km of [[Vierzon]] and [[Bourges]]. [[Mehun-sur-Yèvre]] (5000 inhabitants)is a medium-size town located near Quincy. It is famous for it castle, built by King Charles VII. The river [[Cher (river)|Cher]] cross Quincy. A valley area of lakes, woods and [[farming]] comprising the village and a couple of hamlets, situated by the river [[Cher River|Cher]], some {{convert|9|mi|km}} southeast of [[Vierzon]] at the junction of the D27 and the D20 roads. ==Population== {{Historical populations |align=left| 1962|714| 1968|727| 1975|783| 1982|759| 1990|812| 1999|775| 2008|833| }} {{clear-left}} ==Sights== * The church of St. Germain, dating from the eighteenth century. * The eighteenth-century [[chateau]]. ==See also== *[[Communes of the Cher department]] ==References== *[http://www.insee.fr/en/home/home_page.asp INSEE] {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.quid.fr/communes.html?mode=detail&id=9834&req=Quincy Quincy on the Quid website] {{Fr}} {{Cher communes}} [[Category:Communes of Cher (department)]]
